common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with installing, updating, and customizing the Pieces OS desktop app.  This includes problems with Ollama installation failures within the sandboxed environment on Linux and difficulties updating Pieces OS when installed from the Microsoft Store.  Solutions include patches for Ollama installation and improved update mechanisms for Microsoft Store installations.

related_issues.title: How to change the font of the linux app?
related_issues.text:
How to change the font of the linux app? ### Discussed in https://github.com/pieces-app/support/discussions/600
Originally posted by **rafidahmed816** January 27, 2025 The font is too bold. Can I change the font style? ![Screenshot from 2025-01-27 16-30-12](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fc48f057-36b7-4645-89b8-373702db6fdc)
## GitHub Issue Summary **Key Points:** * User @rafidahmed816 requested the ability to change the font within the Pieces Copilot chats and sidebar. * The existing UI lacks this customization option. * A project is underway to address visual density and font configurations,预计在两周内发布。 **Problems Identified:** * Users lack control over the font within the Copilot chat and sidebar. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * A project is underway to introduce font weight customization options. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The solution is under development with an expected release within two weeks. **Additional Notes:** * The update will be announced through this issue.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Key Issue:** Pieces-OS, installed as a snap, cannot use `curl` to download Ollama model, due to its sandboxed environment.

**Problems Identified:**

- Miscommunication internally about Pieces-OS confinement (strict vs classic).
- Ollama installation not working inside snap's sandbox.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Patch to allow Ollama access from sandboxed environment.
- Infrastructure updates completed.

**Current Status:**

- Solution implemented but not yet released in latest snap update. 
- Target fix for next week (by Jan 30, 2025). 

**Outcome:**

- The issue impacting both downloading and inference will be resolved.

**Additional Points:**

- User frustration with delay and lack of local workaround for inference.

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** User @CPX10 reported that they were unable to update Pieces & PiecesOS on their PC.

**Key Points:**

* The user installed Pieces and PiecesOS from the Microsoft Store, which is not officially supported for in-app updates.
* Reopening the applications or updating them from the Microsoft Store resolved the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* In-app updating for Microsoft Store installations was not working correctly.
* The user experience around updating Microsoft Store builds was not intuitive.

**Solutions Implemented:**

* Workarounds were provided to resolve the immediate issue for the user.
* The team is working on improving the experience around updating Microsoft Store builds.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is closed.

**Outcome:**

* The user's issue was resolved.
* The team is working on improving the update experience for Microsoft Store installations.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App and PiecesOS Launch and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces Desktop App and PiecesOS launching and updating, particularly on Windows.  Problems include non-dismissable overlay messages, update failures, and dependency errors. Proposed solutions involve checking startup configurations, ensuring PiecesOS is running, and verifying installation source (Microsoft Store vs. direct download).

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** ThemePark is unable to launch the Pieces Desktop App on startup.

**Key Points Raised:**

* ThemePark is using Windows 10.
* Pieces Suite, OS, and Desktop are all installed.
* ThemePark suspects the issue is related to PiecesOS trying to update simultaneously with the Desktop App launching on startup.

**Problems Identified:**

* Timing conflict between PiecesOS update and Desktop App launch on startup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack-at-pieces suggests confirming which app is configured to launch on startup (PiecesOS or Desktop App).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* ThemePark has yet to confirm the app configured for startup.
* The conversation is ongoing.

**Additional Information:**

* The Pieces support team recommends checking related issues and resources for further assistance.

**Note:** The conversation is ongoing, and the issue may not be fully resolved yet. More information is needed from ThemePark to determine the next steps.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* User @aspirants2 created an issue reporting problems launching PiecesOS.
* Pieces support bot provided helpful resources and referenced similar existing issues.
* Pieces team member @mack-at-pieces followed up, confirming the problem and offering two solutions.
  
**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS is unable to launch.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

1. Verify PiecesOS is running by accessing http://localhost:39300/.well-known/version in the browser.
2. Schedule a video call with @mack-at-pieces for live troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User has not provided an update on the issue resolution. 
* @mack-at-pieces is awaiting a response from the user to determine the next steps.

recommendations: **Prioritize Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues:** Focus on resolving issues related to Ollama installation failures on Linux and Microsoft Store update problems to improve the user onboarding experience.

**Address Pieces Desktop App and PiecesOS Launch Issues:** Investigate and fix problems with non-dismissable overlay messages, update failures, and dependency errors, particularly on Windows, to ensure a smooth user experience.
**Improve Communication Around Microsoft Store Installations:** Provide clearer guidance to users installing through the Microsoft Store, especially regarding limitations with in-app updates.
**Investigate Linux Sandbox Issues:** Review the Pieces OS sandbox implementation on Linux to ensure compatibility with necessary tools like `curl` and prevent future conflicts.
**Monitor and Analyze Ticket Activity:** Utilize ticket activity levels to identify and prioritize emerging issues or trends, allowing for proactive support and faster resolution times.
